title: Blace.io: Marketplace Creator
description: As marketplaces are being built, repeat work is being executed, cutting into the overall efficiency of developers.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a great proposal to create base level marketplace software as an open source product upon which many Dapps can then be quickly built. Stops repetition of common code and leverages limited core coding skills to large numbers of products.
Great idea that could allow much more efficient development efforts in the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have brought together a strong team with a proven dedication to the community. They have a concise definition of what they want to build and a clear plan.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has clear deliverables, timelines and KPI's. It would be good to add goals to the KPI's to keep the team focused on ensuring the community knows about and uses it, rather than just focusing on building out the product.

f6_assessments.q0:
As a Developer and an Entrepreneur I can strongly agree that creating an Open Source platform, to be used as a base for many DApps and projects will shorten development cycles, increase the amount of Developers pursuing to create DApps and create better quality DApps based on proven libraries that work because of the extensive QA and improvement by the community itself.

I also agree that an open source base Marketplace will be one of the most used by Cardano's developers as it is a common model for many of the real world problems we usually address with a blockchain and its derivatives    (Specially the decentralization and disintermediation ones).
I think the approach taken, putting a Squad together to deliver the first iteration of the code, and later open source it so the community can take the lead and improve and fork it, it is the proper one.
As it is explained on the proposal, the initiative covers most of the challenge objectives and questions and also could lead and serve as a first of many base open source platforms for many developers to leverage and create great DApps and new proposals.
f6_assessments.q1:
All the mentioned team members, posses extensive experience both in Cardano, as well as in other areas as Developers and the creation of Technology based Projects. They are also active members of the Catalyst community so they have a great track record of previous projects delivered or being done.

The plan is very detailed and also provide a list of functionalities that the creator will have, whit a timeline that I see feasible, considering the proposed team to be assembled.

Other importan aspect on feasibility is that they seem to have all the team already selected, so they could potentially start working without delays as soon as funded.

Even though the requested funds are considerable, the seniority of the team, the value of the project delivered and the amount of effort considered are all coherent and worth of the investment.
f6_assessments.q2:
Milestones are SMART, so it can be tracked and audited with just standard reporting and follow up.

They have also provided several KPIs to measure impact of the technology, by measuring how projects use and adopt the MarketPlace Creator to generate their business upon it. So the real impact could be measure and tracked.

Several projects expressed their interest to use the platform so first measurements and indications of adoptions will be available in the short term to better understand the progress and results delivered.

f6_assessments.q0: The need for a hassle-free developer experience encourages rapid development.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has a wealth of experience and that can result in the successful implementation of the proposal
f6_assessments.q2: A more detailed approach in how the team will successfully implement the proposal would still be needed to ensure sufficient auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: Building templates/base layers to simplify the workload of developers definitely increases the positive experience of developers in our ecosystem, which is the goal of this challenge. Therefore, this proposal perfectly fits into this challenge. The positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem is well described and reasonable as well. This solution will increase productivity of developers and also simplifies monitoring and testing. Therefore, I rate the impact of this proposal with 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has some experienced members, that are already very active in Catalyst and have already proofed their engagement. Thus, I am convinced that they will further do so. 
The roadmap is easy to understand and from my experience it looks like a realistic time horizon. Also the technical details about the solution are well described and make it clear what to expect from this proposal.
The budget is clear and from my experience fairly priced.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has presented a detailed roadmap with a clear time horizon. Also some KPIs are mentioned. To better define the success of this proposal the team could have add some number which they want to achieve. Also for further auditability it would be good to see a Github repository (or something similar) here as well. The team has reflected how this project could be run sustainable and what challenge might occur.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is all about increasing efficiency of development, while eliminating duplicate work and chance of mistakes.
It would allow for more marketplaces to be built by a wider range of developers.

The product will be open-sourced for most uses, and licensed to users that will not open-source their use of it, this is an Developer eco-system boosting effort.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is strong and well known within the Cardano Community. 
The Plan is well laid out and provides good insight as to how it will be implemented and even extended beyond it's current plan.
The Budget is reasonable and well defined, as to what resources are used in what ways.
The only MINOR risk I see is that some of the team have other proposals in and this one lists them as Full Time. If they are funded on more than one proposal, they will need to mitigate this time over allotment in some way.
f6_assessments.q2:
The timelines provided are reasonable and provide the ability to clearly determine if milestones have been accomplished.
There are KPI provided for assessing long term success measurements beyond the development of the project.

solution: Provide developers with a base layer marketplace functionality, so they can focus on the specifics of their products and services.
experience: An experienced team of developers, Plutus pioneers, legal experts, project managers, and CTOs.
